Botswana secured a vital 1-0 away victory against Cape Verde in their Africa Cup of Nations Group C qualifier on Thursday.
Tumisang Orebonye scored an early goal just two minutes into the match.
Botswana's defense, led by Goitseone Phoko, held firm against Cape Verde's numerous chances.
Fabrício Garcia and Jovane Cabral came close to scoring late in the game, but Botswana managed to see out the win.
Kabelo Seakanyeng provided a precise through ball for the goal.
Orebonye scored in the 2nd minute for Botswana.
Costa received a yellow card in the 41st minute for Cape Verde.
Velaphi received a yellow card in the 5th minute for Botswana.
Mohutsiwa received a yellow card in the 35th minute for Botswana.
Phoko received a yellow card in the 77th minute for Botswana.
Fabrício Andrade was substituted in for Cape Verde Islands at the 84th minute.
Tebogo Kopelang was substituted in for Botswana at the 84th minute.
Thabang Sesinyi was substituted in for Botswana at the 78th minute.
Tumisang Orebonye scored in the 2nd minute for Botswana.
